channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023090438
item.description:
Report X-2023090438

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE HANDLE DROPPED THE PACKAGE OFF OF THE IC BELT CAUSING THE PACKAGE TO LEAK. MANAGER NOTIFIED QA THEN QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. AFTER THE SPILL WAS CLEANED THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED ON ITS TOP CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT FROM THE CAP AND SOIL THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023090436
item.description:
Report X-2023090436

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A PACKAGE HANDLER PICKING UP FROM THE SHIFT BEFORE NOTICED THIS PACKAGE SITTING IN A TOTE WITH AN IC ON TOP OF IT WITH LIQUID AT THE BOTTOM. THEY REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER WHO CALLED FOR QA TO COME RETRIEVE THE PACKAGE. QA RUSHED DOWN TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE ISSUE AND PLACED THE PACKAGE ON A CART AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO QA. UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION, THE PACKAGE ON TOP WAS SCANNED EARLIER THIS MORNING. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS CRUSHED BY A HEAVY IC PACKAGE. DurationRel: 11 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: BOTH BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023090428
item.description:
Report X-2023090428

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS WAS LEAKING AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER. THEY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER AND NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON THE SIDE. THEY PLACED IT IN THE TOTE LINED WITH THE HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED IT UP WITH FOLD ABSORB. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE WHICH LED IT TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report X-2023090423
item.description:
Report X-2023090423

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-04
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER(S) WERE UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THE PACKAGE FELL OFF OF THE CONVEYOR AND ONTO THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER BREAKING OPEN. THEY NOTIFIED THEIR MANAGER OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG IN A TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT IT BACK AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FELL OFF OF THE CONVERYOR AND ONTO THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER CAUSING ALL THE BOTTLES TO BECOME CRUSHED IN AT THE TOP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report E-2023090775
item.description:
Report E-2023090775

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An Veolia employee was moving the composite IBC with the forklift when it was punctured by the forks of the forklift. Approximately 1-2 gallons of the IBC was spilled onto the floor at Veolia's 10-day intransit facility. The spill was cleaned up and the remaining contents of the tote were transferred to a new container for continued transportation.

item.title: Report E-2023090726
item.description:
Report E-2023090726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 15, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was defective and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the top of the drum and shrink wrap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews replaced the cap on the 55-gallon drum of product. LSH personnel utilized absorbents to wipe off the top of the 55-gallon drum of product. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket for transport and disposal.

Report X-2023090721

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP SENT A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTATED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISON TREE FOR APPRIATE CLEAN UP OF THE LEAKER. RESPONDER TOOK THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023090333
item.description:
Report X-2023090333

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a pacakge handler was loading a trailer, he noticed that a corrosive hazmat pacakge come dawn the shut and one side of the box was wet. He told to his manger. DescribePack: Because the pacakge wet up to the system, three of the gallons got loose cap and spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manager called to QA, QA went to the area with a res tote line with a hazmat bag. QA brought the pacakge tot eh processing cage.

item.title: Report E-2023090662
item.description:
Report E-2023090662

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one 330 gallon poly tote of Carmel concentrate (un1197) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023082038
item.description:
Report X-2023082038

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023082038 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD TO INVESTIGATE AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND USED NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB TO CLEAN UP THE AREA. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED ONE OF THE CONTAINERS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB WERE USED TO CLEAN UP THE AREA. 2. X-2023082039 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE PROBLEM AND THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD WITH A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG, NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB. UPON ARRIVAL, THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS A HAZMAT AND PLACED IT IN THE TOTE WITH THE LINED HAZMAT BAG. THEY USED THE NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB TO CLEAN UP THE AREA. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB.
